author: luigylemon
content:
Is there any reason why at contract creation transactions there is no check to make sure deployed code is not null (0 bytes). It's a pretty annoying footgun. Just got my simple transfer on Arbitrum converted into contract creation by an Alchemy RPC because it removed the "to" property. 
Lost some money on that since mobile UI is not very descriptive for contract deployments and i was just signing a 0 bytes transfer...

Wondering why that footgun case is being allowed by the EVM. It should just revert imo.

author: luigylemon
content: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/156 Ok i guess i fell into a very old well. Still wondering why 0 byte contracts are not reverting

author: luigylemon
content: This recovery idea seems to be  integrated into 867 and pretty much stuck in time (blocked). Would have been nice if the focus was on stopping it from happening first, and only afterwards finding a solution for recovery. Since 2016 how many more cases of this happened when it was so much easier to not allow the creation of 0 byte contracts.
